keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: An online magazine identified a key Boko Haram member, Abu Musab al-Barnawi, as the “governor” of West Africa, indicating a major promotion.

headline.print_headline: Boko Haram May Have a New Leader, ISIS Magazine Suggests
headline.main: Boko Haram May Have a New Leader, ISIS Magazine Suggests

snippet: An online magazine identified a key Boko Haram member, Abu Musab al-Barnawi, as the “governor” of West Africa, indicating a major promotion....
abstract: Islamic State magazine Al-Naba contains excerpts of interview with Boko Haram member Abu Musab al-Barnawi that refers to him as 'governor' of West Africa, which raises questions among terrorism experts about group's leadership.
